thread.title: Five old dating spots your parents used to go to
thread.title_full: Five old dating spots your parents used to go to

title: Five old dating spots your parents used to go to
text:
Five old dating spots your parents used to go to We step into Singapore’s past with five dating spots your folks used to frequent By Rebecca Liew Posted: Thursday November 17 2016 1/5 Sentosa 
The Island of Death: that’s what ‘Pulau Blakang Mati’ stood for before it was renamed to Sentosa in 1972. Getting there was easy – either by cable car, monorail, ferry or, following its construction in 1992, the Sentosa Causeway. The novelty of the cable cars meant scores of lovebirds would flock to the island to take in the then-newly built attractions: among them the Sentosa Coralarium and its lookout tower, Palawan beach lagoon, the Butterfly Park, and the musical fountain that a few of you might still remember from your childhood. There was even a roller-skating complex that opened there in 1975 – and who can forget Fantasy Island in the ’90s? COUPLE TALK Saadah Khamis, 53, and Ramli Ani, 56 ‘There weren’t many places to go around Singapore back then, and Sentosa was the place to be – we’d go on double dates with our friends. Most of our dates were spent either here or in a cafeteria in Changi Airport that’s since closed down, sadly.’
